newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Cons Paper says margins recovering.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Cons Paper says margins recovering.

text.p: Paper merchant Consolidated Paper Industries Ltd said on Thursday that trading margins were gradually recovering to former levels as industry demand and supply were coming back into balance.
Earlier, the company reported a 78.3 percent fall in full year net profit to A$2.02 million.
Consolidated Paper said international paper prices bottomed in June and had already seen some small increases.
This followed trading conditions in the second half which the company described as the most difficult it had ever experienced, with a slump in prices that continued through the first quarter of 1996.
Consolidated Paper shares closed untraded but were bid at A$2.45, unchanged from its previous close on August 21.
